intro: Kieseria anceps, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming a compact rosette. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and are pollinated by insects. Kieseria anceps is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
